  • Constructor Details

    • OTVertex

      public OTVertex​(TreeVertexAdapter parent, VisualNode node)
      Construct a vertex wrapper of a VisualNode for the OTLayout.
      Parameters:
      parent - Parent vertex.
      node - VisualNode to be wrapped

  • Method Details

    • firstWalk

      public void firstWalk​(int num, int depth)
      Applied recursively to all children as well as the function 'apportion'. After spacing out the children by calling ExecuteShifts, the node is placed at the midpoint of its outermost children.
      Parameters:
      num - Ordinal position in a list of siblings.
      depth - tree depth

    • secondWalk

      public void secondWalk​(OTVertex p, double m, int depth)
      Computes all real x-coords by summing the modifiers recursively.
      Parameters:
      p - The vertex to set.
      m - The modifier
      depth - current depth.

    • getPrelim

      public double getPrelim()
      Getter for the preliminary position x.
      Returns:
      current value.

    • setPrelim

      public void setPrelim​(double prelim)
      Setter for the preliminary position x.
      Parameters:
      prelim - x position

    • getNumber

      public int getNumber()
      Getter for the ordinal position amongst siblings.
      Returns:
      vertex position.

    • setNumber

      public void setNumber​(int number)
      Setter for the ordinal position amongst siblings.
      Parameters:
      number - ordinal postion

    • getThread

      public OTVertex getThread()
      Getter for the thread current vertex. 'Threads' are used to traverse the inside and outside contours of the left and right subtree up to the highest common level.
      Returns:
      current thread.

    • setThread

      public void setThread​(OTVertex thread)
      Setter for the thread current vertex. 'Threads' are used to traverse the inside and outside contours of the left and right subtree up to the highest common level.
      Parameters:
      thread - The vertex in the thread chain.

    • getAncestor

      public OTVertex getAncestor()
      Ancestor either points to itself or to the root of the tree it belongs to.
      Returns:
      current ancestor.

    • setAncestor

      public void setAncestor​(OTVertex ancestor)
      Ancestor either points to itself or to the root of the tree it belongs to.
      Parameters:
      ancestor - The ancestor.

    • getMod

      public double getMod()
      Getter for the stored distance required to center a sub-tree.
      Returns:
      current mod.

    • setMod

      public void setMod​(double mod)
      Setter for the stored distance required to center a sub-tree.
      Parameters:
      mod - mod to store.

    • getShift

      public double getShift()
      Getter for the saved calculated x distance to shift so that this node does not overlap another. This is another term used to maintain linear time efficiency.
      Returns:
      current saved shift.

    • setShift

      public void setShift​(double shift)
      Setter for the saved calculated x distance to shift so that this node does not overlap another. This is another term used to maintain linear time efficiency.
      Parameters:
      shift - amount to shift x.

    • getChange

      public double getChange()
      Getter for the actual distance x shifted.
      Returns:
      distance x

    • setChange

      Setter for the actual distance x shifted.
